title: Jeremy Clarkson considered doing "nothing at all" after Top Gear axe - Top Gear TV
text: Jeremy Clarkson has admitted that he considered doing "nothing at all" after being axed from Top Gear.The presenter was dropped from the BBC motoring show after a "fracas" with a producer, and he recently revealed that he entered rehab following his axe. © Splash News / Ian LawrenceJeremy Clarkson leaving his home in London Writing in his latest Sunday Times Driving column, Clarkson explained that he did not know whether co-stars Richard Hammond and James May would leave with him."I didn't really know what I was going to do," he said. "A large part of me considering the appealing option of 'nothing at all'. A smaller part thought I should change tack and do a programme about farming."When [Richard and James] spoke, they made supportive noises, but unlike the US marines, the three of us have always operated under the rule that we do leave a man behind." © Amazon Prime VideoJames May, Jeremy Clarkson and Richard Hammond The trio went on to sign a deal for a new Amazon Prime show with a reported budget of £160 million."And then, riding over the horizon on a white charger, in a brown cardboard envelope, came Amazon," Clarkson continued."It took us to its London headquarters and showed us the tech it had lined up for the very near future, made us an offer in English - well, it was in American, actually, but that's close enough - and that was that, we had a new home."With a skeleton crew, filming for Amazon Prime's new motoring programme has begun. pic.twitter.com/8PaYvke5il— Jeremy Clarkson (@JeremyClarkson) October 7, 2015He added that online programming offered many opportunities, but there was a lot of "legal gobbledygook".Additionally, he said that the McLaren P1 will be one of three cars to appear in the first episode of the new series.Clarkson posted a picture of the cast and crew of the new show - rumoured to be called Gear Knobs - on Twitter last week.
